title: Support Orbital Temple - Join the Mission
heading: Support Orbital Temple
vision: On November 28, 2025, Orbital Temple will launch from India aboard an ISRO rocket. A participatory art satellite from the Global South, it is a monument to radical inclusion, a platform for education, and a catalyst for global conversation about the future of the sacred in the age of technology, AI and space exploration.

accomplished.heading: What We've Accomplished
accomplished.content: After four years of research and development, the mission is ready. We have completed hardware and software development for the satellite, passed official shaker tests required for flight certification, and finalized our contract with ISRO. The satellite is built. The technology works. We are cleared for launch.

needs.heading: What We Need Support For
needs.intro: To complete this historic mission and maximize its impact, we need support for five critical components:

decade.heading: The Decade Ahead
decade.intro: This mission doesn't end on November 28, 2025. It's just beginning.
decade.paragraph1: For the next 10 years, this satellite will orbit Earth, responding to names sent from every corner of the planet. The educational program aims to train thousands of teenagers in satellite technology, breaking the Space Gap for the Global South. The documentary will reach millions worldwide, sparking conversations about belonging, memory, and the sacred.
decade.paragraph2: Orbital Temple is partnering with Sathi Roy and The Roy Foundation to make this decade-long vision culturally significant. The Roy Foundation is a nonprofit dedicated to expanding access to spiritual education, emotional healing, and consciousness tools for underserved communities worldwide, bridging ancient wisdom and modern technology to create a more conscious, connected, and compassionate world. Together, we're building the infrastructure to ensure Orbital Temple becomes a lasting movement that reaches communities across the globe.
decade.paragraph3: Your support doesn't just fund a launch; it creates a movement that will echo for a decade and inspire the next generation of space artists and engineers.

individualDonations.intro: Join the mission at a level that works for you. Individual supporters are the foundation of this historic project.

fundingOpportunities.intro: Your contribution directly funds specific aspects of the mission. Choose what speaks to you, or combine multiple to create a larger impact.

launch.title: Fund the Space Launch
launch.description: The actual launch cost aboard the ISRO rocket on November 28, 2025. This sends Orbital Temple into orbit, where it will remain for a decade as a participatory art satellite and temple in the sky, accessible to anyone in the world.
launch.benefits: You receive: "Launch Sponsor" title · Featured in all press releases · On-screen documentary acknowledgment · VIP access to launch events · Join quarterly video calls with Edson and the mission team · Certificate with satellite orbital data · Tax-deductible receipt

travel.title: Fund the Artist's Journey to India
travel.description: Travel, accommodation, and production costs for artist Edson Pavoni and core team to witness the launch in India on November 28, 2025. This trip is essential for documentary filming, media coverage, and representing the Global South at this historic moment.
travel.benefits: You receive: Personal thank you from artist · Behind-the-scenes documentary access · Name in documentary credits · Tax-deductible receipt

carbon.title: Fund the Carbon Offset Program
carbon.description: All carbon emissions will be neutralized, including the rocket launch and the fabrication of the satellite. We are working with verified carbon offset programs to ensure that this mission leaves no negative environmental footprint.
carbon.benefits: You receive: Name in website honor roll · Personalized certificate · Tax-deductible receipt

education.title: Fund the Educational Program
education.description: Develop and launch the complete multilingual course teaching Global South teenagers how to build satellites. Includes curriculum development, video production, platform hosting, and the first year of scholarships for underserved students. Creates lasting infrastructure for space education.
education.benefits: You receive: "Education Founding Sponsor" recognition · Scholarships in your name · Featured in educational materials · Meet the first cohort of students your scholarship funded (virtual or in-person) · Documentary feature segment · Speaking opportunity at launch events · Tax-deductible receipt

docPreProd.title: Fund the Documentary Pre-Production
docPreProd.description: Fund the initial phase of "What Makes a Temple?" documentary. Includes conducting 2 in-depth interviews in India with thought leaders and spiritual practitioners, small crew travel and production, and editing of pre-production footage. This phase establishes the documentary's foundation and validates the creative direction.
docPreProd.benefits: You receive: Associate Producer credit · Name in documentary credits · Private screening of pre-production footage · Behind-the-scenes access · Tax-deductible receipt

docProd.title: Fund the Documentary Production
docProd.description: Complete production and post-production of "What Makes a Temple?", the feature documentary exploring the intersection of art, technology, and the sacred. Includes filming in multiple countries, additional interviews with thought leaders, comprehensive editing, color grading, sound design, and premiere screenings in India and NYC.
docProd.benefits: You receive: Executive Producer credit · Featured in opening credits · Private screening for your guests · World premiere invitations (both cities) · Private dinner with Edson and documentary director before premiere · Behind-the-scenes access · Tax-deductible receipt

artCollector.title: Become the Only Orbital Temple Art Collector
artCollector.imageAlt: Orbital Temple installation at Mercosul Biennial
artCollector.imageCaption: Orbital Temple at the 13th Mercosul Biennial, Porto Alegre. Photo by Clara Marques.
artCollector.paragraph1: Three identical satellites were built for this mission. One will launch to space on November 28, 2025. One travels to museum exhibitions worldwide. One is reserved for a generous collector who wants to fund this vision and own a piece of space art history.
artCollector.paragraph2: This is not a replica; it is one of the three original satellites. A fully functional spacecraft that is also a sculpture. The satellite measures 5cm³ and weighs 245g, with a dome made of gold.
artCollector.paragraph4: As the collector, you will receive the same installation created for the 13th Mercosul Biennial, a complete museological display that showcases the satellite as both art and technology. This installation has been exhibited at major international venues and represents the highest standard of space art presentation.
artCollector.paragraph5: Your support helps to fund the entire vision: the launch, the educational program, and the documentary that will spark global conversations about the sacred in the age of technology, AI and space exploration. Your name becomes permanently intertwined with this historic mission.

gratitude.intro: Orbital Temple is made possible by institutions, individuals, and believers in radical inclusion who understand that art creates tomorrow's imaginaries.

gratitude.yourName: Your name could be here. Join us in creating history.

people.heading: The People Behind This Mission
people.intro: Orbital Temple is a 10-year commitment. It's led by two people who have spent their lives bridging art, technology, and human connection, and who are building the infrastructure to sustain this vision for the decade ahead.

edson.name: Edson Pavoni
edson.paragraph1: Edson is an artist and technologist who explores human intimacy at the intersection of art and technology. His practice spans architectural installations, poetry, photography, and satellite technology.
edson.paragraph2: His work has been exhibited at the 13th Mercosul Biennial (Brazil), IX International Biennale (Uzbekistan), and NTU Global Digital Art Prize (Singapore).
edson.paragraph3: With over 20 years in the field of art and technology, he has worked with creative teams for the 2016 Rio Olympics and Inter American Development Bank. Named one of the 50 most innovative Brazilian professionals by Proxxima Magazine, he received two consecutive IF Design Awards (2017-2018) and was a Lumen Prize Futures Award finalist. His work has been exhibited in two biennials and presented at Ludwig Museum of Contemporary Art (Budapest), Inhotim Institute (Brazil), and Design and Fashion Museum (Lisbon), with exhibitions in New York, Beijing, Singapore, Dubai, Rio de Janeiro, and other cities.

sathi.name: Sathi Roy
sathi.role: Founder, The Roy Foundation & Strategic Partner
sathi.paragraph1: Sathi is the founder of The Roy Foundation, a nonprofit dedicated to expanding access to spiritual education, emotional healing, and consciousness tools for underserved communities around the world. The foundation partners with schools, cultural institutions, and local organizations to distribute AI-powered wellness tools, community curriculum, and media that inspires transformation.
sathi.paragraph2: With a background in neuroscience, coaching, and leadership, Sathi has built and led teams across North America and India, generating $600 million in annual sales at one venture. She is also the founder of OHM, a digital-first spiritual movement, Co-Founder of SUTE (a digital AI-driven office platform), and serves as Advisor and Global Head of Growth for RISE Global Creative.
sathi.paragraph3: As a Bengali-American woman who bridges Eastern and Western philosophies, Sathi brings a unique perspective to spiritual and artistic movements in the 21st century. With a growing network of 65,000+ followers and over 40 million online impressions, she is building global communities that connect across cultural and spiritual divides.

people.together: Together with The Roy Foundation, we're building a 10-year mission that bridges art, technology, education, and the sacred, starting with a satellite launch on November 28, 2025, and continuing with a movement that will reach underserved communities worldwide and inspire the next generation.

join.heading: Join Us
join.content: The satellite is built. The technology is ready. The launch date is set: November 28, 2025. This is the moment to join a mission that reimagines what art can do, where it can go, and who it can serve.
